name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
List
description: Entry::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of entries.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

entries = logging.entries
if entries.next?
  next_entries = entries.next
end

require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

entries = logging.entries
if entries.next?
  next_entries = entries.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves remaining results by repeatedly invoking #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result, which is passed as the argument to the block.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method will make repeated API calls until all remaining results are retrieved. (Unlike #each, for example, which merely iterates over the results returned by a single API call.) Use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each log entry by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

entries.all do |e|
  puts "[#{e.timestamp}] #{e.log_name} #{e.payload.inspect}"
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

all_payloads = entries.all.map do |entry|
  entry.payload
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

entries.all(request_limit: 10) do |e|
  puts "[#{e.timestamp}] #{e.log_name} #{e.payload.inspect}"
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all log entries. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each log entry.
